messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] Re: New to Un-Schooling
messages.msgSnippet: Hello Meredith, Thank you for the links of information. I may have incorrectly use the word TEACH in a manner that may have concluded that I am teaching at
messages.messageBody:
Hello Meredith,
Thank you for the links of information. I may have incorrectly use the word
TEACH in a manner that may have concluded that I am teaching at home. I
should have used the word SHOWING mine as well as all children in the
UN-schooling forum.
Thank you, Mary

On 9/15/07, Meredith <meredith@...> wrote:
>
> Hi, Mary, I'm Meredith, mom to Mo, who has "always" been unschooled and
> stepmom to Ray, who has lived and unschooled with us for almost a year
> now! We're in TN.
>
> > I new knew to this site but not new
> > to home schooling, NONE of us are. We all teach our children from
> birth.
>
> I'm going to direct you to some unschooling references - a significant
> part of the basic philosophy of unschooling is that learning does not
> require teaching:
>
> http://joyfullyrejoycing.com/unschooling/teachingversuslearning.html
> http://sandradodd.com/wordswords
>
> ---Meredith (Mo 6, Ray 13)
>
>
>



--
Mary Champion-McCune

messages.subject: Re: New to Un-Schooling
messages.msgSnippet: Hi, Mary, I m Meredith, mom to Mo, who has always been unschooled and stepmom to Ray, who has lived and unschooled with us for almost a year now! We re in
messages.messageBody:
Hi, Mary, I'm Meredith, mom to Mo, who has "always" been unschooled and
stepmom to Ray, who has lived and unschooled with us for almost a year
now! We're in TN.

> I new knew to this site but not new
> to home schooling, NONE of us are. We all teach our children from
birth.

I'm going to direct you to some unschooling references - a significant
part of the basic philosophy of unschooling is that learning does not
require teaching:

http://joyfullyrejoycing.com/unschooling/teachingversuslearning.html
http://sandradodd.com/wordswords

---Meredith (Mo 6, Ray 13)

messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] New to Un-Schooling
messages.msgSnippet: We just stopped in Charleston on our way back from the Live and Learn conference. Normally we re in Oklahoma, and we d be glad to penpal with you. Welcome to
messages.messageBody:
We just stopped in Charleston on our way back from the Live and Learn
conference. Normally we're in Oklahoma, and we'd be glad to penpal
with you.
Welcome to the group!
Melissa
Mom to Josh (12), Breanna (10), Emily (8), Rachel (7), Sam (6), Dan
(4), and Avari Rose (19 months)

share our lives at
http://360.yahoo.com/multimomma



On Sep 13, 2007, at 12:35 PM, marmar843 wrote:

> Hello all,
> My name is Mary and I am a SAHM. I new knew to this site but not new
> to home schooling, NONE of us are. We all teach our children from
> birth.
> This is our 2nd day of officially UN-schooling our 7 year old
> daughter.
> We live in North Charleston, South Carolina. I would love to connect
> with other home schoolers in this area and pen-pal with others from
> across the globe.
> have fun UN-schooling
> Mary
>
>
>

messages.subject: New to Un-Schooling
messages.msgSnippet: Hello all, My name is Mary and I am a SAHM. I new knew to this site but not new to home schooling, NONE of us are. We all teach our children from birth. This
messages.messageBody:
Hello all,
My name is Mary and I am a SAHM. I new knew to this site but not new
to home schooling, NONE of us are. We all teach our children from birth.
This is our 2nd day of officially UN-schooling our 7 year old daughter.
We live in North Charleston, South Carolina. I would love to connect
with other home schoolers in this area and pen-pal with others from
across the globe.
have fun UN-schooling
Mary
